glsa.title: Heimdal: Buffer overflow vulnerabilities
glsa.synopsis: Buffer overflow vulnerabilities have been found in the telnet client in Heimdal which could lead to execution of arbitrary code.

background.p: Heimdal is a free implementation of Kerberos 5 that includes a telnet client program.

description.p: Buffer overflow vulnerabilities in the slc_add_reply() and env_opt_add() functions have been discovered by Gael Delalleau in the telnet client in Heimdal.

impact.p: Successful exploitation would require a vulnerable user to connect to an attacker-controlled host using the telnet client, potentially executing arbitrary code with the permissions of the user running the application.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.
